premiumEconomy.tooltipText: For short-haul flights equipped with premium economy seats, they are marketed as "Main Cabin Extra" seats in the economy class.

business.tooltipText: For US-domestic flights, business class is marketed as "first"class if the aircraft does not have separate business and first class cabins.

first.tooltipText: For US-domestic flights, business class is marketed as "first" class, except on aircraft with both business and first class cabins. In such cases, there is no published award price for first class, but it is typically higher than the business class price.

premiumEconomy.tooltipText: For short-haul flights equipped with premium economy seats, they are marketed as "Main Cabin Extra" seats in the economy class.

first.tooltipText: For AA-operated flights with a first-class cabin, there is no published award price specifically for first class. However, it is typically priced higher than the business class award.

premiumEconomy.tooltipText: For short-haul flights equipped with premium economy seats, they are marketed as "Main Cabin Extra" seats in the economy class.

first.tooltipText: For AA-operated flights with a first-class cabin, there is no published award price specifically for first class. However, it is typically priced higher than the business class award.

For AA-operated flights with a first-class cabin, there is no published award price specifically for first class. However, it is typically priced higher than the business class award.
For AA-operated flights with a first-class cabin, there is no published award price specifically for first class. However, it is typically priced higher than the business class award.
